thread.title: Plan your Sunday: Things to do today in O.C.
thread.title_full: Plan your Sunday: Things to do today in O.C. - The Orange County Register

title: Plan your Sunday: Things to do today in O.C.
text:
Here are a few things happening in Orange County on Sunday, Oct. 18.
FALL FAIRE & PUMPKIN PATCH 
Pumpkins of all shapes and sizes will be available to buy. Come take a great family photo in a cute pumpkin patch while you’re shopping. Purchase food and drinks at the ENC Taste of OC. Dance along to music from the Laguna Beach DJ’s. Native plants will be available for purchase. Children can participate in a variety of fun crafts, get their faces painted and play fun games. Treat yourself to a henna tattoo, and then let it dry as you watch a performance on the Fire Circle Stage. See a live bird of prey presentation by the OC Bird of Prey Center. Take a ride on a friendly pony or visit a variety of barnyard animals in the petting zoo.
10 a.m.-3 p.m. at the Environmental Nature Center, 1601 E. 16th St., Newport Beach.
Info : encenter.org .
THEATER: 'ABUNDANCE' 
By Beth Henley; directed by Martin Benson. 1860. A stagecoach pulls into a station in the middle of the Wyoming Territory. Off step two mail order brides, one innocent and wide-eyed, the other spunky and assertive. For the next quarter of a century, they struggle with the incongruities of fate while clinging to their dreams in a fierce and funny story set in a wild West that would have daunted even Thelma and Louise. Originally produced by South Coast Repertory 25 years ago, this dark comedy by Pulitzer Prize winner Beth Henley (“Crimes of the Heart”) has found a new life, both here and in New York.
2:30 and 7:30 p.m. at South Coast Repertory, 655 Town Center Drive, Costa Mesa. Tickets start at $22.
Info : scr.org .
CONCERT: LUKE BRYAN 
Ever since being crowned as the Top New Artist at the 2010 Academy of Country Music awards, his tour dates have been country music’s hottest ticket. While Bryan is now riding the success of back-to-back No. 1 singles, it was not until 2001 that Bryan finally got his chance for stardom when he moved to the country music capital.
7 p.m. at Verizon Wireless Amphitheatre Irvine, 8808 Irvine Center Drive.
Info : verizonwirelessamphitheatreirvine.com .
CIRQUE DU SOLEIL: KURIOS 
Written and directed by Michel Laprise, KURIOS – Cabinet of Curiosities is a tale in which time comes to a complete stop, transporting the audience inside a fantasy world where everything is possible. In this realm set in the latter half of the 19th century, reality is quite relative indeed as our perception of it is utterly transformed. The name of the show refers to the humble and strange characters that inhabit the Seeker’s Cabinet of Curiosities.
8 p.m. at OC Fair & Event Center, 88 Fair Drive, Costa Mesa.
Info : cirquedusoleil.com .
GEM FAIRE 
Shop for fine jewelry, gems, beads, minerals, crystals, findings and more at manufacturer’s prices. Plus, find nearly 200 exhibitors from around the world, classes, demonstrations, jewelry repair, ring sizing and free hourly door prizes.
10 a.m.-5 p.m. at OC Fair & Event Center, 88 Fair Drive, Costa Mesa. Tickets are free-$7.
Info : gemfaire.com .
LAGUNA FILM FESTIVAL 
Closing day of the shorts from around the world include Youth-Produced Shorts, 11 a.m.-1 p.m.; Film School Student Shorts Part 2, 1:30-3:30 p.m.; and Awards, 4-4:45 p.m. at Regency Directors Cut Cinema, 25471 Rancho Niguel Road, Laguna Niguel.
Info : lagunafilmfestival.com .
THE CAKE & PARTY EXPO 
For those passionate about baking, creating, cake decorating and entertaining, the expo offers celebrity demos, classes and hands-on workshops.
9 a.m.-6 p.m. at OC Fair & Event Center, 88 Fair Drive, Costa Mesa. Admission is $20-$45.
Info : cake-expo.com .
ON TV: 'JESSE STONE: LOST IN PARADISE' 
Tom Selleck returns for a seventh installment in the series of mystery movies based on the work of novelist Robert Parker. In the latest, Stone is called to consult on a Boston murder case that may be linked to a serial killer.
9 p.m. Hallmark.
